definitions.definition: A small, often temporary, pool of water, usually on a path or road.
A homogeneous mixture of clay , water, and sometimes grit , used to line a canal or pond to make it watertight .
The ripple left by the withdrawal of an oar from the water.

main_definition: A small, often temporary, pool of water, usually on a path or road. [from 14th c.]
secondary_definitions: ( now dialectal ) Stagnant or polluted water . [from 16th c.]
A homogeneous mixture of clay , water, and sometimes grit , used to line a canal or pond to make it watertight . [from 18th c.]
( rowing ) The ripple left by the withdrawal of an oar from the water.
